title: nanako_sos
body:
"Nanako SOS is a seinen manga series created by [[Azuma Hideo]] which ran in Popcorn and Just Comic (both published by Kobunsha) from April 1980 to July 1986. The series was adapted into 39-episode anime TV series produced by Kokusai Eiga which aired on the Fuji Television network from April 2, 1983 to December 24, 1983. Azuma created additional manga stories which ran in Azuma Magazine from July 2001 to July 2004.

Enoki Films held the North American distribution rights of TV series, under the name Nana the Supergirl, though the series was never aired in North America. The TV series has also aired in Italy, France, Germany and Russia." [1]


h4. Characters

* [[nanako (nanako sos)|Nanako]]


h4. Links

* [1] "Wikipedia entry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanako_SOS

title: genba_neko_(meme)
body:
lit. "accident site cat" or "work site cat", translated on Pixiv as "#safety cat"

* !post #7146200

Originally based on [[Denwa Neko (kumamine)|an image of a cat]] asking "why are you up so late at night?", the genba neko meme primarily references a cat in a hard hat pointing and saying 「ヨシ！」 (Okay!). Unfortunately, the conditions referenced by the cat are often not "Okay!" as a result of simple job site carelessness, overwork leading to accidents, substance abuse, and other gross safety violations. While most pictures refer the pointing "Okay!" image, some call back to the image of the cat on the phone, some depict the tragic aftermath of workplace accidents, and some foreshadow such events (references to [[Strong Zero]] and other alcoholic beverages, close-ups of the cat sweating unnaturally, and notes about how workers who skip holidays "are built different"). Some common variations can be seen on the "Genba Neko Twitter bot":[https://twitter.com/genbaneko_bot].

title: miyano_shiho
body:
The real identity of [[Haibara Ai]] who used to be in the Black Organization under the code name Sherry. This tag is for her adult form.

Her name comes from detective fiction writer [[Miyano Murako]] and speculatively science fiction writer [[Hoshi Shin'ichi]].

title: edogawa_conan
body:
The titular character of [[Meitantei Conan]], the disguise name taken by high-schooler [[Kudou Shin'ichi]] after he was forced to take a drug that was supposed to kill him, but instead shrunk him back to a young child. He still possesses his adult intellect, which helps him solve crimes while hiding his identity from all but a select few.

His name comes from two detective fiction writers, [[Edogawa Ranpo]] and [[Arthur Conan Doyle]].

title: kudou_shin'ichi
body:
The original identity of [[Edogawa Conan]], Shin'ichi is a high-school detective who was forced to take a poison that should have killed him, but unexpectedly shrunk him into a child. He secretly pursues the Black Organization that caused this in order to heal his deformity and to bring them to justice. There are occasions when Shin'ichi returns to his regular age in order to fool his childhood friend [[Mouri Ran]] so she doesn't think he's either dead or is Conan.

His name comes from fictional detective [[Kudou Shunsaku (tantei monogatari)|]] and science fiction writer [[Hoshi Shin'ichi]].

title: haibara_ai
body:
A girl who used to be called [[Miyano Shiho]] and was in the Black Organization under the code name Sherry. After the Organization kills her older sister [[Miyano Akemi]], Shiho takes the same drug that shrunk [[Kudou Shin'ichi]] and likewise becomes a child herself to escape, renaming herself Haibara Ai. She is blunt and cool-headed, but becomes frightened whenever the Organization is discussed or nearby.

Her name comes from fictional detective [[Cordelia Gray]] (灰 = gray) and Sherlock Holmes character [[Irene Adler]].

title: kaitou_kid
body:
The gentleman thief identity of [[Kuroba Kaito]] and previously of his father [[Kuroba Touichi]]. Titular character of [[Magic Kaito]], also makes cameos in [[Meitantei Conan]].

Wears a [[white suit]] with a matching [[white cape|cape]], [[white pants|pants]] and [[white hat|top]] [[top hat|hat]], a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[dress shirt]] and [[red necktie]], and wears a [[monocle]].

title: agasa_hiroshi
body:
A character from [[Meitantei Conan]]. A genius inventor who is the first person to learn of [[Kudou Shin'ichi]] being shrunk as a child. He helps Shin'ichi by maintaining his identity as [[Edogawa Conan]] and inventing various gadgets for Conan to apprehend culprits.

His name comes from detective fiction writer [[Agatha Christie]].

title: jabba_the_hutt
body:
A fictional [[alien]] character from the [[Star Wars]] saga.

[b]Jabba Desilijic Tiure[/b], better known as [b]Jabba the Hutt[/b], is one of the most notorious Hutt crime lords in the galaxy, who governs a large criminal empire located in the Outer Rim Territories from his desert palace on planet [[Tatooine]]. Known for his cruelty and carnal fancies, Jabba is one of the most powerful crime lords in the galaxy. 

Jabba's criminal empire started as a small crime lord, but the alien quickly spread his influence into a variety of illegal activities, including spice-smuggling, gunrunning, slavery and sometimes outright piracy.

title: sherlock_holmes
body:
Fictional detective created by Scottish author Sir [[Arthur Conan Doyle]]. Commonly portrayed with a [[deerstalker]] hat and curved pipe. Best known for his catchphrase "Elementary". Assisted by Doctor [[John Hamish Watson]] and frequently opposed by the professor [[William James Moriarty]]. Solved cases using logical reasoning, disguises and the new field of forensic science.

title: apex_legends_mobile
body:
The smartphone port of [[Apex Legends]] developed in collaboration between Tencent's LightSpeed Studios and Respawn Entertainment, and released on May 17, 2022. This version of the game is completely separate from the original console/PC release, though it's lore is still considered canon to the Apex/Titanfall universe.

Apex Mobile contains exclusive content not present in the main game, including new legends, skins, maps, and game modes. Use this tag for any posts that feature Mobile-exclusive content or directly reference the mobile version of the game.

The port ended service on May 1, 2023.

h4. Exclusive Legends
* [[Fade (apex legends)|]] / Ignacio Huamani
* [[Rhapsody (apex legends)|]] / Linh My Vo

h4. Exclusive Weapons
* [[The Constellation (apex legends)|]]

h4. See Also
* [[High Energy Heroes]] - a blatant clone game of Apex Mobile by co-developer Lightspeed, released within months of ALM's closure

title: horizon_(apex_legends)
body:
Playable legend in [[Apex Legends]], added to the game in season 7. A scientist who was left for dead at a black hole, and found that 87 years had passed on her homeworld after she escaped.

Horizon has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|brown]]/[[orange hair]] (depending on the depiction) and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of slim blue [[spacesuit]] with a pair of [[goggles on head|goggles on her head]]. While she was born on Psamanthe, she is of Scottish descent and speaks with a Scottish accent.

She is [[Newton Somers]]' mother, and her main motivation for remaining in the games is to return to her original time period to reunite with him. Due to her betrayal, she has a strong animosity against both [[Ashleigh Reid]] and her simulacrum [[Ash (titanfall 2)|]]. Horizon is heavily associated with [[Olympus (apex legends)|]], having been released in the same season. Her heirloom weapon is the [[Gravity Maw]].

Horizon is voiced by "Elle Newlands":[https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/Elle-Newlands/] in English and "Aruga Yukiko":[https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/Yukiko-Aruga/] in Japanese.

title: iran
body:
A country in Western Asia, officially known as the [b]Islamic Republic of Iran[/b]. Historically referred to as "Persia", the country is a regional military and cultural centre, as well as a hub for Shia Islam. The country is ruled by monarchy (or "shah") for over 2,500 years until it was replaced with a pseudo-theocratic republic regime in 1979.

Internationally the Iranian leadership's staunch anti-[[United States|American]] and anti-[[Israel|Zionism]] stance, as well as its support of several insurgent group around the middle east is well known. 

h4. See also
* [[Persia]]
* [[Islamic Republic of Iran Ground Forces]]
* [[Islamic Republic of Iran Air Forces]]
* [[Iranian flag]]
other_names: イラン・イスラム共和国

title: steven_seagal
body:
[b]Steven Frederic Seagal[/b] (b. 10 April 1952)

A Hollywood actor, stuntman and producer. Was once a hit actor during the late 1980s and early 1990s, today he is considered a has-been, out of shaped actor doing direct to DVD movies due to his ego making him unlikeable and hard to work with. Depicted as an admiral in [[Kantai Collection]] by [[k2 (hibiki09)|]], likely due to his portrayal of a sailor in [[Under Siege]] and his collaboration with [[World of Warships]].

The game is set in the 25-26th century revolving around three major races: Terrans, Zerg and Protoss. The expansion, [b]Brood War[/b], is merged together with this tag.

title: oberon_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Oberon (fate)|]] in his Third Ascension form from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. His hair is [[black hair|black]], and he wears a blue [[diamond hairband]]. He wears a [[white shirt]], [[black pants]], and a large [[black cloak|black]] [[fur-trimmed cloak]] comprised of multiple torn [[fairy wings]]. His right hand remains humanoid, but his left arm turns into a dark [[claws|claw]], and his legs and feet also turn dark. He gains a pair of [[dragonfly wings]], which aren't capable of helping him fly.

[b]Major spoilers for Lostbelt no. 6: Fairy Realm of the Round Table, Avalon le Fay![/b]

[spoiler]This is his true Pretender-class form when he awakens as Oberon Vortigern, the Insect of the Abyss summoned to destroy the British Lostbelt.[/spoiler]

[b]This Ascension is considered a major spoiler for the events of Lostbelt no. 6: Fairy Realm of the Round Table, Avalon le Fay. The [[spoilers]] tag MUST be added when tagging this Ascension![/b]

h4.See also

* [[Oberon (Overnight Dream) (Fate)]]
* [[Oberon (Moody Summer Oberon) (Fate)]]

title: human_weapon
body:
When a character is being used like a [[weapon]], such as being treated like a melee weapon or being used as a projectile, etc.

This tag is when the character is [b]literally[/b] being used as a weapon. Do not apply this tag simply because the character metaphorically is seemingly dangerous ("like a human weapon").

Not to be confused with [[human shield]], where one character is simply using other character to protect themselves at the other's expense.

title: kurusu_natsume_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Kurusu Natsume]], as seen in post #6417230. 

Her current default costume, released November 23, 2020 as her 50,000 subscribers milestone, comprises a [[sleeveless]] [[blue shirt]], a [[white sweater]] wrapped [[sweater around neck|around her neck]], [[floral print]] light [[blue skirt]], and black [[high heels]]. 

[b]Note:[/b] Despite the name, this tag refers to her [i]current[/i] default costume, which she started using in November 23, 2020, and is her second chronologically. For the default costume she originally used when she first debuted, see [[Kurusu Natsume (old design)]].

title: murakami_yoshikiyo
body: Murakami Yoshikiyo (村上 義清, 1501–1573) was a Japanese samurai from the Murakami clan and retainer of the Uesugi clan during the Sengoku period of the 16th century. Yoshikiyo followed in fighting against both [[Takeda Nobutora]] and his son [[Takeda Shingen]]. Yoshikiyo was also a very close ally under [[Uesugi Kenshin]] and one of Shingen's bitterest opponents for his high kill-counts in their conflicts.

title: frye_(splatoon)
body:
[i][[Splatoon 3]][/i] character. Full name is [b]Frye Onaga[/b]. Named [b]Utsuho[/b] in the Japanese version. Member of the band Deep Cut and an [[inkling]].

She has [[star-shaped pupils]] just like the other Inkling Idols [[Callie (Splatoon)|]], [[Marie (Splatoon)|]] and [[Pearl (splatoon)|]]. She also has [[long pointy ears]], notably longer than most Inklings. Other unique elements of her default costume & appearance include: [[white pants|white]] [[harem pants]], [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[sleeveless shirt]] as a [[crop top]], a [[yellow shawl]], [[multiple earrings|multiple]] [[tooth earrings]], and [[colored eyelashes]]. Her hairstyle includes an [[x hair ornament]] and a [[hair tie]].

In her boss battle in the story mode, she controls [[moray eel]]s.

* [[Big Man (Splatoon)|]]

title: nipple_bar
body:
A type of [[nipple piercing]], nipple bars are [[barbell piercing]]s affixed to the [[nipples]]. The most common form is a simple straight bar with beads on each end.

Sometimes depicted with something attached to it, such as [[nipple jewelry]] or a [[nipple chain]].

h4. See also

title: nipple_rings
body:
A ring-shaped [[nipple piercing]]. Use this if the piercing forms a closed loop of rigid material between both points of insertion into the skin. If it is not a complete loop, or the loop is completed by non-rigid material such as chain, it should likely be tagged as [[nipple bar]] (and possibly [[nipple jewelry]]) instead.

Sometimes depicted with something attached to it, such as [[nipple jewelry]], a [[nipple chain]], [[nipple weights]], or [[used condom]].

title: dragon_ball_xenoverse
body:
[[Dragon Ball]] video game series, with Xenoverse in 2015 and Xenoverse 2 in 2016. Draws various lore elements from [[Dragon Ball Online]] and builds upon them (parallel to [[Dragon Ball Heroes]] doing the same).

You play as the [[Mirai Senshi]] (Time Patroller) and, as a member of the [[Time Patrol (dragon ball)|]] and [[Trunks (Future) (Xeno) (Dragon Ball)|Xeno Future Trunks]]'s partner, go back in time to help maintain the timeline against [[Towa (dragon ball)|]] and [[Mira (dragon ball)|]]. Notable for introducing [[Chronoa]], the Supreme Kai of Time, to the franchise.

title: zero_(mega_man)
body:
[b]Zero[/b] ([b]ゼロ[/b]) is one of the three main characters of the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series, as well as the protagonist of the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series. He also makes an appearance as Biometal [[Model Z (mega man)|]] in the [[Mega Man ZX]] series. 

A high ranking Maverick Hunter in the X series, and a legendary freedom fighter in the Zero series, he's a die hard warrior who doesn't hesitate to take action. However, behind his cold and emotionless attitude lies a wounded soul.

He was created by [[Dr. Wily (mega man)|Dr. Albert W. Wily]] during the [[Mega Man (series)|]] series. As such, his designation is DWN-∞ (Infinity). [spoiler]He has the Maverick Virus contained in a gem inside his head which [[Sigma (mega man)|]] smashed the gem, causing the Maverick Virus to infect Sigma. Subsequently, Zero no longer showed any signs of Maverick behavior while Sigma became a Maverick.[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[Black Zero (mega Man)|]], Zero's upgraded armor
* [[Absolute Zero (mega man)|]], an additional form for Zero obtainable in [[Mega Man X: Command Mission]].
* [[DiVE Armor Zero (mega man)|]], an armor exclusive to [[Mega Man X DiVE]]
* [[Bliss Zero (mega man)|]], a [[genderswap]]ped version of Zero from [[SVC Chaos]].
* [[Zero Nightmare (mega man)|]], an evil copy of Zero from [[Mega Man X6]].
* [[Zero(z) (mega man)|Zero(Z)]], his redesign in the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|Zero series]]
* [[Zero.exe (mega man)|]], his counterpart in the [[Mega Man Battle Network (series)|]] series.

title: mira_(kendeshi)
body:
Mira (ミラ) is the protagonist of the series [[Kenja no Deshi wo Nanoru Kenja]].  She is depicted as a young girl with [[very long hair|very long]] [[silver hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

Mira is the female appearance of the young working man Sakamori Kagami's player avatar in the VRMMORPG Ark Earth Online.  Kagami's avatar, Danblf Gandador, is normally a wizened old man with long white hair and long beard that he based on famous fantasy wizards.  While toying with the appearance editor and seeing what he could create for a female appearance, Kagami blacked out and awoke as his avatar with the female appearance he had just created.

The name Mira is derived from the English word Mirror (Mirā, ミラー, in Japanese), and is taken from Kagami's name sounding the same as the Japanese word for mirror, Kagami (鏡).

title: claw_pose
body:
A hand pose imitating [[claws]].

Stereotypically hands at face level ; palm outward ; knuckles slightly arched ; fingers fanned out and up, curled (base may be reversed, rest may be extra bent) but tips not pointing towards the hand.

May be part of a [[fighting stance]], or intent to grab.

title: twin_braids
body:
A hairstyle that consists of two [[braid]]ed lengths of hair.

This can be the hair in front of the ears, like [[sidelocks]], or the hair behind the ears, like [[twintails]].

If the [[braid]]s are tied low, below ear-level, they're [[low twin braids]]. If the back of the hair is tied into two full-length braids, then they're also [[twintails]].

title: cao_cao
body:
[b]Cao Cao[/b] (曹操), courtesy name [b]Mengde[/b] (孟德), was a Chinese statesman, warlord, and poet who rose to power towards the end of the [[Han Dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] and became the effective head of the Han central government during that period. He laid the foundation for what was to become the state of [[Cao Wei]] (220–265), established by his son and successor [[Cao Pi]], who ended the Eastern Han dynasty and inaugurated the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms period]] (220–280). 

Cao Cao rose to prominence in the 190s during which he recruited his own followers, formed his own army, and set up a base in Yan Province (covering parts of present-day Henan and Shandong). In 196, he received [[Emperor Xian]], the figurehead Han sovereign who was previously held hostage by other warlords such as [[Dong Zhuo]], [[Li Jue]], and [[Guo Si]]. After he established the new imperial capital in Xuchang, Emperor Xian and the central government came under his direct control, but he still paid nominal allegiance to the emperor. Throughout the 190s, Cao Cao actively waged wars in central China against rival warlords such as [[Lu bu|Lü Bu]], [[Yuan Shu]], and [[Zhang Xiu]], eliminating all of them. Following his triumph over the warlord [[Yuan Shao]] at the Battle of Guandu in 200, Cao Cao launched a series of campaigns against Yuan Shao's sons and allies over the following seven years, defeated them, and unified much of northern China under his control. In 208, shortly after Emperor Xian appointed him as Imperial Chancellor, he embarked on an expedition to gain a foothold in southern China, but was defeated by the allied forces of the warlords [[Sun Quan]], [[Liu Bei]], and [[Liu Qi]] at the decisive Battle of Red Cliffs.

His subsequent attempts over the following years to annex the lands south of the Yangtze River never proved successful. Cao Cao died in Luoyang in March 220 and was succeeded by his son Cao Pi, who accepted the abdication of Emperor Xian in November 220 and established the state of Cao Wei to replace the Eastern Han dynasty. This marked the transition from the Eastern Han dynasty to the Six Dynasties period. After taking the throne, Cao Pi granted his father the posthumous title "Emperor Wu" ("Martial Emperor") and the temple name "Taizu" ("Grand Ancestor"). 

h5. Adaptations in popular culture:
* [[Shin Sangoku Musou]] (Dynasty Warriors) 
* [[sousou (koihime musou)|Sousou "Karin " Moutoku]] from [[Koihime Musou]]
* [[Sousou Moutoku]] from [[Ikkitousen]]
* [[ sousou moutoku (sangoku hime)|Sousou Moutoku]] from [[Sangoku Hime]]

title: lion_king_(lancer)_(fate)
body:
A version of [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer) (Fate)|]], a Lancer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She wields [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|Rhongomyniad]] instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|Excalibur]].

This version of Artoria is as she appears in [spoilers] the Camelot Singularity of Fate/Grand Order, who is actually the Goddess Rhongomyniad.[/spoilers] One physical difference from the original is that her eyes are lifeless and colored bright lime green, with glowing yellow pupils. A good example of this is post #3835074. She might also sport an [[Expressionless]] face, be shown with a white colored cape and in her First Ascension she will have a helmet with white fur. Regular Lancer Artoria uses a red cape and yellow fur.

She can also summon her horse named [[Dun Stallion (fate)|]] and is associated with the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate) ]]. 

Designed by [[Ishida Akira]] and voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

h4. See also

title: the_dark_knight_rises
body:
The Dark Knight Rises is a [[2012]] superhero film directed by Christopher Nolan, who co-wrote the screenplay with his brother Jonathan Nolan, and the story with David S. Goyer. Based on the [[DC Comics]] character [[Batman]], it is the final installment in Nolan's The Dark Knight trilogy, and the sequel to [[The Dark Knight]] (2008). The film stars [[Christian Bale]] as [[Bruce Wayne]] / Batman, alongside Anne Hathaway, Gary Oldman, Tom Hardy, [[Morgan Freeman]], Marion Cotillard, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, and Michael Caine. Eight years after the events of The Dark Knight, the terrorist [[Bane]] forces Bruce Wayne to resume his role as Batman and save Gotham City from nuclear destruction.
h4. See also

title: the_dark_knight
body: The Dark Knight is a 2008 superhero film directed by Christopher Nolan from a screenplay co-written with his brother Jonathan. Based on the [[DC Comics]] superhero [[Batman]], it is the sequel to [[Batman Begins]] (2005) and the second installment in The Dark Knight trilogy. The plot follows the vigilante Batman, police lieutenant [[James Gordon]], and district attorney [[Harvey Dent]], who form an alliance to dismantle organized crime in Gotham City. Their efforts are derailed by the Joker, an anarchistic mastermind who seeks to test how far Batman will go to save the city from chaos. The ensemble cast includes [[Christian Bale]], Michael Caine, Heath Ledger, Gary Oldman, Aaron Eckhart, Maggie Gyllenhaal, and [[Morgan Freeman]].

title: poh_(sao)
body:
An antagonist in [[Sword Art Online]], whose real name is [b]Vassago Casals[/b]. He is the dreaded founder and former leader of Laughing Coffin, a guild of murderers, before joining Glowgen Defense Systems under the command of [[Gabriel Miller]]. Has an obsessive hatred of [[Kirito]].

His avatar's appearance is identical to his real-life appearance, with [[brown hair]], [[dark skin]], [[red eyes]] and a blue tattoo on the right side of his face. He also wields the [[Mate Chopper]], a dagger resembling a Chinese [[kitchen knife]], which becomes stronger with every player it kills.

The word "PoH" (pronounced "pooh") is an abreviation of [b]P[/b]rince [b]o[/b]f [b]H[/b]ell

title: maou_no_ore_ga_dorei_elf_wo_yome_ni_shitanda_ga_dou_medereba_ii?
body:
The original title roughly means, "As the Demon King, what would be the right way to love my elf slave bride?"
Official English Title: "An Archdemon's Dilemma: How to Love Your Elf Bride"

A light novel by Fuminori Teshima and illustrated by C O M T A.

The sorcerer Zagan spends his fortune to buy [[Nephelia]] ("Nephy"), a white-haired elven slave (rumored to make good magic sacrifices), after falling in love with her at first sight.  His dark magic terrifies her, as does the torture device-riddled abandoned castle he's been squatting in, convincing her that he's more interested in torturing her than love, especially since he's too antisocial to string together a sentence.  Also, The Church is convinced he's the flesh-reaping serial murdering sorcerer that targets virgins, and has sent holy knights to bring him to justice, led by a [s]side romantic interest[/s] sword maiden he once saved.

Hilarity ensues.

Not to be confused with [[Isekai Maou To Shoukan Shoujo no Dorei Majutsu]], the OTHER light novel about a Maou with a busty elf slave waifu.

title: original_remodel_(kantai_collection)
body:
Term applied to a fan artist's own rendition of what a particular [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] character's [[remodel_(kantai_collection)|second remodel]] would look like, either in clothes, gear, or both. This tag applies to a shipgirl whose second remodel has yet to be implemented at the time of drawing, especially if that shipgirl would eventually get an official second remodel that is significantly different than what the fan artist imagined.

So-called "third remodels" also count as original remodels; [[bismarck (kancolle)|Bismarck]] has an official "Drei" form, [[kongou (kancolle)|Kongou]] has an official third "what if" remodel, [[Shigure (kancolle)|]] has also been given [[shigure_kai_san_(kancolle)|a third retrofit]], and no other shipgirl has a form beyond a second remodel, barring seasonal CGs, although [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]]'s nominal second remodel can be considered an actual third remodel due to the existence of her [[tan yang (kancolle)|Tan Yang]] form. Hypothetical costumes and gear that come with a yet-to-be-implemented eventual name change or form (such as Tan Yang's, pre-official implementation) can also be considered original remodels.

The tag is especially useful if a shipgirl, such as a destroyer, is given an outfit similar to those worn by her officially remodeled sisters. This is typical for shipgirls of the same class and/or fleshed out by the same illustrator.

Even if an original remodel correctly predicts an official remodel, this tag should be used depending on when the original remodel was published in relation to the release of the official one. [[shikinami (kancolle)|Shikinami's]] is a good example; her second remodel was made known through the official Kancolle calendar for 2020 (announced November 2019), but some fan artists have drawn it in some form long before that, probably using [[ayanami (kancolle)|Ayanami's]] as the basis (such as post #3841559, posted on Twitter April 2, 2019). [[yura (kancolle)|Yura's]] is another example; post #2534054 guessed in late 2016 her second remodeled form which was mostly confirmed as first teased on Comptiq's June 2017 issue (post #2719435).

h4. Examples
Compare these remodels as envisioned by [[Minosu]]...
* !post #2848628: [[Tama (kancolle)|Minosu's Tama Kai Ni]]
* !post #3000890: [[Shiranui (kancolle)|Minosu's Shiranui Kai Ni]]
* !post #2963474: [[Tenryuu (kancolle)|Minosu's Tenryuu Kai Ni]]
* !post #3169675: [[Yamato (kancolle)|Minosu's Yamato Kai Ni]]

With these official remodels
* !post #2951522: [[Tama Kai Ni (kancolle)|Official Tama Kai Ni]]
* !post #3125417:  [[Shiranui Kai Ni (kancolle)|Official Shiranui Kai Ni]]
* !post #3187762:  [[Tenryuu Kai Ni (kancolle)|Official Tenryuu Kai Ni]]
* !post #5416387:  [[Yamato Kai Ni (kancolle)|Official Yamato Kai Ni]]

title: kyatto_ninden_teyandee
body:
[i]Kyatto Ninden Teyandee[/i] (Cat Ninja Legend Teyandee)

Better known in the West as "Samurai Pizza Cats", the show was picked up for localisation in the early 90s. However, incomplete/incomprehensible scripts forced the dubbing company to instead ad-lib the episodes, creating a pun-laden series that may be the first "gag dub".
Despite this, the series is still fondly remembered, and became a bigger hit outside Japan than in its homeland.

h4. Characters [i](US dub name)[/i]

* [[Yattarou (kyatto ninden teyandee)|]] (Speedy Cervice)
* [[Pururun (kyatto ninden teyandee)|]] (Polly Esther)
* [[Sukashii]] (Guido Anchovy)
* [[otama_(kyatto_ninden_teyandee)|Otama]] (Francine)
* [[Nyago King]] (The Supreme Catatonic)
* [[Tokugawa Usako]] (Princess "Vi" Violet)

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyatto_Ninden_Teyandee

title: pharah_(overwatch)
body:
[i]"I will protect the innocent."[/i]

Real Name: Fareeha Amari
Age: 32
Occupation: Security Chief
Country: Egypt

An offense-class character in [[Overwatch]]. Fareeha Amari (call sign: "Pharah") comes from a long line of highly decorated soldiers and burns with the desire to serve with honor. An altruistic individual, Pharah seeks to make the world a better place, and bring order out of chaos. [[Ana (Overwatch)|Ana Amari]] is her mother.

VA: Jen Cohn (English), [[paku_romi|Romi Park]] (Japanese), Irina Indigo (Latin American Spanish), Diana Torres (European Spanish), Ethel Houbiers (French)

title: type_100_smg
body:
A Japanese [[submachine gun]] produced and used by the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] during [[World War II]]. Firing the 8x22mm Nambu cartridge, the weapon features a traditional wooden rifle stock without a pistol grip and [[magazine (weapon)|]] that is detached on the left-side.

It is the signature weapon of [[Izuna (blue archive)|Izuna]] from [[Blue Archive]].

title: mano_(narumi_arata)
body:
マノ
[[Original]] character created by [[narumi_arata]]. 
She has black hair.
She is close friends with [[Recri (narumi arata)|]].

h4. Profile 

From pixiv #1498065, the original post featuring her:
[quote]名前は「マノ」といいます。妖精の女の子、口数少なくて心配性な子ですよ。[/quote]
[quote]Her name is "Mano". She's an elf girl that doesn't say much and is prone to worrying.[/quote]

From her character page"[1]":[/wiki_pages/46990#dtext-external-links]
[quote]
◇名前：マノ
◇性別：女の子
◇年齢：13歳
◇種族：妖精

◆マノについて
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
マノはレクリのともだちの妖精さんです。
性格は内気で口数は多くありませんが、いつもいろんなことを考えてます。
見た目が無愛想に見えることをちょっと気にしています。

家族から溺愛されている愛されキャラです。
部屋にぬいぐるみとか乙女チックなものから、よく分からない置物まで、いろんな物を置いています。趣味の幅が広いです。

魔法がちょっと使えます。ちなみにこの世界の魔法は主に庶民的なことに使われます。
[/quote]
[quote]
◇Name：Mano
◇Gender：Female
◇Age：13
◇Race：Elf

◆About Mano
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Mano is an elf and Recri's friend.
She's shy and doesn't  say much, but she's always thinking about various things.
She worries a bit that she appears unfriendly.

家族から溺愛されている愛されキャラです。
部屋にぬいぐるみとか乙女チックなものから、よく分からない置物まで、いろんな物を置いています。趣味の幅が広いです。

Mano can use magic a little. ちなみにこの世界の魔法は主に庶民的なことに使われます。
[/quote]

title: recri_(narumi_arata)
body:
レクリ
[[Original]] character created by [[narumi_arata]]. 
She has long pink hair. 
She is close friends with [[mano_(narumi_arata)|Mano]].

h4. Profile
From pixiv #1497974, the original post featuring her:
[quote]名前は「レクリ」といいます。人間とアクマのハーフ、元気っ子ですよ。[/quote]
[quote]Her name is "Recri". She's an energetic, half-human half-demon girl.[/quote]

From her character page"[1]":[/wiki_pages/47079#dtext-external-links]
[quote]
◇名前：レクリ
◇性別：女の子
◇年齢：14歳
◇種族：コアクマ

◆レクリについて
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
レクリは人間とアクマのハーフです。レクリのいる世界ではそんなヒトたちのことを「コアクマ」と呼んでいます。
性格は穏やかですが、楽しいことが大好きな活発な子です。
ヒトを惹きつける力があり、本人も社交的なのでいろんなヒトと仲良くなれますが、関係は基本的に広く浅い感じです。マノとは大の仲良し。

レクリは魔法が使えません。魔法の能力に長けたアクマ族の母を持っているだけに、そのことをちょっと気にしています。

ときどき、経験したことのないことを「思い出す」ことがあります。
[/quote]

[quote]
◇Name：Recri
◇Gender：Female
◇Age：14
◇Race：Little Devil

◆About Recri
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Recri is a half-human, half-demon. In Recri's world, such people are called "Little Devils".
She has a calm personality, but she's an active girl that loves having fun.
ヒトを惹きつける力があり、本人も社交的なのでいろんなヒトと仲良くなれますが、関係は基本的に広く浅い感じです。She is close friends with Mano.

Recri can't use magic. 魔法の能力に長けたアクマ族の母を持っているだけに、そのことをちょっと気にしています。

ときどき、経験したことのないことを「思い出す」ことがあります。
[/quote]

title: takanashi_akiho_(chichi8181)
body:
[[chichi8181]]'s most prominent [[original]] character. Her design vary somewhat between pictures but she is usually depicted with [[long_hair|long]]  [[brown hair]], with [[sidelocks]] that are some times [[blunt_sidelocks|blunt]]. Her eyes are drawn as [[red eyes|red]], [[brown eyes|brown]] or [[black eyes|black]], with [[white pupils]]. A distinctive feature is the [[gold necklace|gold]] maple-leaf [[pendant]] she's almost always shown wearing, in line with the general autumn theme of the character (down to her name). As most of the artist's characters, she has [[huge breasts]], which are often covered by a [[pink sweater]]. She is often shown drinking [[alcohol]].

Character profile: post #7270459

title: virtopia_club
body:
[i][Researching...][/i]

Former Chinese-speaking [[virtual youtuber|VUP]] group, formed by "a group of friends who come together to play videogames". It comprised casual video game streamers and artists, each with a Vtuber persona, but membership was by invitation only. The group was founded in October 10, 2020 and dissolved in February 1, 2022.

h4. Members

Original character of the Chinese artist and [[Bilibili]] livestreamer [[Xing]].  A [[black hair|black-haired]], [[red eyes|red-eyed]] [[cat girl]] who frequently exhibits a [[jitome]] expression. title: shigoto_neko
body:
Illustrations by [[Kumamine]], centered around sketchy-looking cats who are working.

Born out of the [[denwa neko (meme)|viral]] popularity of [[Denwa Neko (kumamine)|]] (PhoneCat), originally drawn in 2016. Denwa Neko would be adopted by [[Futaba Channel]] and turned into [[Genba Neko (character)|]] (SiteworkerCat), now depicted wearing a yellow [[hard hat]] with a green cross on it, and doing the now-iconic "Okay! (Yoshi!)" [[genba neko (meme)|pose]]. Kumamine would remake the character as [b]Shigoto Neko[/b] (WorkCat), and depict the hard hat in white with a paw print logo on it, for legal reasons as to be able to market the character (such as LINE stickers and collabs with other brands and local governments).

title: hylia
body:
A character from the backstory of [[The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword]].  

[spoiler]She was the goddess the creator gods entrusted with protecting the [[Triforce]].  

Long before the events of Skyward Sword, [[Demise (zelda)|]] attacked, and was sealed away, while Hylia sent the humans to the sky.

She then shed her divinity to reincarnate as a mortal, so she could use the Triforce to deal with Demise once and for all.

Her human form is [[Princess Zelda]].[/spoiler]

title: song_of_the_south
body:
Controversial 1946 [[Disney]] animated and live-action movie about a young boy Johnny and his friendship with the [[Uncle Remus]]. As the movie is set a plantation in the Reconstruction era after the [[American Civil War]], the film featured a large number of [[racism|racist]] black stereotypes, which led to the movie being a subject of polarizing debate and was withheld from re-release by Disney ever since.

Aside from racial stereotype issue, it is more positively well known for it's animated segments featuring talking animals which are still used in [[Disneyland]] and related merch.

title: odin_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Odin[/b] is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A spell caster who serves [[leo (fire emblem fates)|Leo]]. In order to create cool critical attacks, he does nothing but research magic all day and night. Often, he claims his roused power runs wild although actual harm is not likely.

He is voiced by Takahashi Hidenori in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Dark Mage

h4. See also

* [[Owain (Fire Emblem)]]

title: forrest_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Forrest[/b] (フォレオ, [i]Foleo[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Forrest is the son of [[leo (fire emblem fates)|Leo]] and the cousin of [[siegbert_(fire_emblem)|Siegbert]]. A notably kind, sympathetic young man, he also has a great fashion sense and excels at making clothes. He also suffers from hemophobia.

He is voiced by Yuuta Takahashi in the Japanese version and by Max Mittelman in the English localization. Forrest is the only character who shares his English voice actor with his own father.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Troubadour

title: brynhildr_(tome)
body:
The legendary tome used by [[leo (fire emblem fates)|Leo]] from [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. It summons enchanted plant material to attack, which appears in the form of a tree in-game. Fan depictions may show Brynhildr summoning e.g. thorns.

Brynhildr is later passed to Leon's son, [[forrest (fire emblem)|Forrest]].

title: niles_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Niles[/b] (ゼロ, Zero) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]

He serves [[leo (fire emblem fates)|Leo]] and was originally a thief. He was born with rare blessings such as theft, assassination, and those sorts of skills, making him prominent in Nohr. He likes to see others suffer, and has the peculiarity of speaking with hidden meanings.

He is voiced by [[Koyasu Takehito]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Thief

title: leo_(fire_emblem_fates)
body:
[b]Leo[/b] (レオン Reon) is a playable character in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

He is the younger prince of Nohr and a general of the kingdom's army. Unlike his older brother Xander, he uses magic. A master tactician, Leo is known for his keen intellect and sharp tongue. Along with the other royal siblings, he was subject to the family's "concubine wars" at a young age. He likes tomatoes the most out of anyone in the army, and his birthday is on June 30th.

He is voiced by [[Miyano Mamoru]] in Japanese and "Max Mittelman":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Mittelman in English.

[b]Starting Class:[/b] Dark Knight

title: nino_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character from [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]]. She is a former member of the Black Fang, being [[Sonia (fire emblem: the blazing blade)|]]'s adoptive daughter, and eventually becomes the mother of [[Raigh (fire_emblem)|]] and [[Lugh (fire emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]].

Nino has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She is almost always seen wearing a [[purple hairband]] and a [[purple cape]]. Her usual attire also includes a white outfit with [[long sleeves]], that seem to closely resemble a [[white dress]], though can be alternatively interpreted in art as [[white skirt]]/[[white shirt|shirt]] combo. She also uses two [[belt|belts]] (one of them with a [[pouch]]) and a blue piece that resembles a vest.
 
CV: Yuki Kana (JP), Sarah Blandy (EN)

title: sonya_(fire_emblem_gaiden)
body:
A playable character from [[Fire Emblem Gaiden]] and its remake, [[Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia]], who is recruitable in [[Celica (Fire Emblem)|]]’s route. She is [[Jedah (Fire Emblem)|]]’s daughter, who seeks vengeance against her father for turning her older sisters, [[Marla (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Hestia (Fire Emblem)|]], into witches. She also serves the Bandit King [[Grieth (Fire Emblem)|]], alongside [[Deen (Fire Emblem Gaiden)|]], but secretly hates him.

Her original [i]Gaiden[/i] design gave Sonya [[long hair|long]], [[red hair]] with a [[two-tone cape]] and a [[red dress]]. Her redesign in [i]Echoes[/i] retains many of these features, but recolors her hair to purple and changing its style. Her dress also now has a red and black pattern, and her cape is now purple on the inside. Additionally, Sonya possesses a [[circlet]] and a pair of diamond-shaped [[earrings]].

Not to be confused with [[Sonia (fire emblem: the blazing blade)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]].

h4. See also
* [[sonya (resplendent) (fire emblem)|Resplendent Sonya]]
* [[sonya (spring) (fire emblem)|Spring Sonya]]
* [[sonya (beautiful mage) (fire emblem)|Rearmed Sonya]]

title: topo_gigio
body:
[b]Topo Gigio[/b] (Italian pronunciation: [ˈtɔːpo ˈdʒiːdʒo]) is a little puppet [[mouse (animal)|]] character that was the lead character of a children's puppet show on Italian television in the late 1950s and early 1960s. The character, created in 1958 by artist Maria Perego, her husband Federico Caldura, and fellow artist Guido Stagnaro, debuted on Italian television in 1959 and has been customarily voiced by actor Giuseppe "Peppino" Mazzullo and later Davide Garbolino. The Italian nickname "Gigi" is a derivative of Luigi ("Louis"), so Topo Gigio could be translated as [b]Louie Mouse[/b].

Topo Gigio was very popular in [[Italy]] for many years—not only on TV, but also in children's magazines, such as the classical Corriere dei Piccoli, animated cartoons, merchandising and movies. In 1963, the character's popularity spread to the world after being featured on The Ed Sullivan Show in the U.S.

Today, Topo Gigio still has fans and has become an icon of Italian pop culture. He performs regularly at Zecchino d'Oro festival and other programs created by Antoniano and RAI. The character also spawned two feature-length motion pictures, The Magic World of Topo Gigio (1965) and Topo Gigio and the Missile War (1967), an anime series, and a 2020 animated series of the same name.

The puppet has made appearances and has a fan base in many other countries—including [[Argentina]], Bolivia, [[Brazil]], [[Chile]], [[Colombia]], Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, El Salvador, [[Ecuador]], [[Guatemala]], [[Japan]], [[Mexico]], Nicaragua, Honduras, Panama, Paraguay, [[Peru]], [[Portugal]], Puerto Rico, Romania, [[Spain]], Uruguay, [[Venezuela]] and the former [[Yugoslavia]].

title: bishamonten
body:
毘沙門天 (pronounced as '[i]Bishamonten'[/i] in Japanese, 'Vaiśravaṇa' in Sanskrit) is one of the most popular "'[i]tenbu[/i]' (天部, deva)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deva_%28Buddhism%29 in Japan. Devas are former gods of Hindu mythology which became the guardian deities of Buddhism.
He has various characteristics and figures in different regions. In Japan, he is a warrior god wearing Chinese-style [[armor]], holding a [[spear]] and a miniature pagoda ([[bishamonten's pagoda]]). In Chinese folklore, he has an [[umbrella]] and a silver [[mouse (animal)|]].
He is a member of the "Four Heavenly Kings":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Heavenly_Kings (Kanji: 四天王) and the guardian god of the northern direction. Another name for him is 多聞天 (Tamonten, lit. 'Much hearing god').
In Japanese folklore, he is a member of '[i]Shichi Fukujin[/i]' (七福神, the [[Seven Lucky Gods]]).

[[Toramaru Shou]] in the [[Touhou]] series is a disciple of Bishamonten, as is [[Uesugi Kenshin]] in the [[Sengoku Musou]] series.

h4.See also

* Wikipedia: "Vaiśravaṇa":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vai%C5%9Brava%E1%B9%87a 
* Wikipedia: "Four Heavenly Kings":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Heavenly_Kings 
* Wikipedia: "Seven Lucky Gods":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seven_Lucky_Gods

title: ludovico_technique
body:
A fictional behavioral correction treatment from Anthony Burgess' [[A Clockwork Orange]]. The participant is [[restrained]], injected with a nausea-inducing compound, and has their eyes forced open; an assistant applies [[eye drops]] to keep them from drying out. They are then made to watch violent films while feeling ill, with the intent being to condition a feeling of nausea at the sight of violence. The treatment resembles [[torture]] more than anything helpful. 

The technique was made famous by Stanley Kubrick's adaptation of the novel, which parodies [[scene reference|reference]].

title: don_gitsune
body:
The mascot character for [[Nissin]]'s [[Nissin donbei|Donbei]] [[Donbei Kitsune Udon|Kitsune]] [[Instant Udon|Udon]], combining the product's name with kitsune. Originally debuted in 2017 in "live-action commercials":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TnMFOvqHWJ0], where the character was played by [[Yoshioka Riho]] until 2022 (after which point an animated version designed by [[Mika Pikazo]] replaced her). The mascot character can be depicted in many ways (including through existing characters), but on Danbooru, it is popularly used to refer to Yoshioka, and one of two [[kimono]]-wearing [[fox girl]]s who appeared in animated commercials from 2022 (post #5789807 and post #5837771).

title: gaius_julius_caesar_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s depiction of [[Julius Caesar]], the dictator of Rome and a general who made a name for himself in the Gallic Wars and the Britannia Expedition and his contribution to the rise of what would have later become the Roman Empire.

Caesar is depicted as being [[fat]] in-game, with him claiming it to be the result of him being "not properly summoned" and thus not at his peak performance, though his extremely gluttonous diet would seem to suggest otherwise. [[cleopatra (fate)|Cleopatra]] is his wife, and she is always insistent about him losing weight.

title: cleopatra_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s depiction of Cleopatra VII, one of the last pharaoh of ancient [[Egypt]] from the Greek Ptolemaic dynasty. Best known for her intimate relationships with [[Gaius Julius Caesar (fate)|]] and Mark Anthony, her legend surrounding her beauty, and her struggle to keep Egypt independent from Rome's rule.

Cleopatra is depicted as a bright and fashionable woman, evident by her [[contemporary]] clothing in her first two ascensions. When it comes to her past relationships, Cleopatra does not have any romantic feelings towards Anthony and views him as a good friend, while she still retains her love for Caesar and is in a [[husband and wife]] relationship with him.

Designed by [[Komatsuzaki Rui]] and voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].

title: miwa_shirow
body:
Japanese name: 三輪士郎 (Miwa Shirou)
Circle name: m.m.m. + Gee

Male Japanese mangaka and illustrator. He created the manga [[DOGS: Bullets & Carnage]] which has been turned into an anime OVA and also did the artwork for [[7th Dragon 2020]]. He also illustrated the official artwork for the video game series [[No More Heroes]] and [[Puzzle & Dragons]] (designing [[Sakuya (p&d)|]] and Sandalphon), as well as guest artwork for [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. He also is one of the artist members of [[supercell (band)|]]. He likes drawing fanart for various other works, Japanese and Western alike. His favorite music includes [[Nine Inch Nails]] and Rammstein.

body: Supercell is a Japanese Pop Rock band formed in 2007 by musician and songwriter Ryo. The band is best known for having previously featured Vocaloid voicebank [[Hatsune Miku]] early into their career.

title: yorigami_shion
body:
[b]The Most Despicable and Disastrous Eldest Twin Sister[/b]

Main antagonist of [i][[Antinomy of Common Flowers]][/i] along with her [[sisters|sister]], [[Yorigami Jo'on]].

Being a Poverty Goddess, Shion is depicted in tatters, unlike her sister. She wears a [[hair bow]] atop her [[blue hair]]. Her hair length is ambiguous; Harukawa's portrait of her depicts her with [[long hair]] blending with her blue aura, but the in-game sprites depict her with [[short hair]]. She has [[blue eyes]]. Shion wears a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[grey hoodie]] with the [[hood down]] and a [[blue skirt]], going [[barefoot]]. She also has a black [[stuffed cat]] perched on her arm and she holds a [[damaged]] [[bowl]]. Similar to her sister, she wears [[bangle|gold bangles]]. Debt papers cover Shion's clothes and her stuffed cat. Do not confuse them with the ofuda covering Mokou's pants.

Shion is a Poverty Goddess, and stores bad luck and debts within her. As more and more is stored within her, she explodes and scatters bad luck around. Her ability allows her to possess people to reduce their luck and make them poor. Shion is usually Jo'on's cohort in her scams.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Shion Yorigami":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Shion_Yorigami

title: whip_sword
body:
A combination [[sword]] and [[whip]]. Usually, this is a sword that splits into sections connected by an internal string, but can also apply to an extremely flexible sword.

Notable examples include:
* [[Isabella Valentine|Ivy]]'s weapon from the [i][[Soulcalibur]][/i] series
* [[Signum]]'s [[Laevatein (nanoha)|]] from the [i][[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha]][/i] series
* [[Galient]]'s sword from [i][[Kikou-Kai Galient]][/i]
* [[Threaded Cane]] from [[Bloodborne]]
* [[Abarai Renji]]'s [[Zabimaru]] from [[Bleach]] (in its Shikai form)
* [[Brighid (xenoblade)|]]'s dual Whipswords from [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]]
* [[Kanroji Mitsuri]]'s special Nichirin Katana from [[Kimetsu no Yaiba]]
* [[Byleth (fire emblem)|]]'s [[Sword of the Creator]] from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]

Only use this tag if the whip nature is shown. Do not use it if the weapon is only in normal sword form. Do not confuse this tag with [[chainsword]], which is a sword with moving [[chainsaw]] parts.

Pixiv tags are 蛇腹剣 (lit. accordion sword) and ガリアンソード (Galient's sword).

title: signum
body:
A character in [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's]].

She appears in neither the previous series [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha]] nor the alternate universe story [[Triangle Heart]], but appears in [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha StrikerS]]. Signum is the leader of the Wolkenritter (German for "Cloud Knights"), a creation of the Book of Darkness.

Signum's weapon is a chain-link [[whip sword]] called [[Laevatein (nanoha)|]], and as a magical creation, she has no familiar. She is named for the Opel Signum, much like characters of Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha are named for cars, and her device appears to be named after the mythical sword Laevateinn. As per the other Wolkenritter, she has no last name.

She is voiced by [[Shimizu Kaori]] (Japanese) and Bailey Chadwick (English).

h4. See also

* [[Laevatein (nanoha)|]]

title: nova_(crush_crush)
body:
[b]Nova[/b] is a phone fling girl unlocked in [[Crush Crush]] after reaching level 25 Brooding (angst).  She is encountered after texting the player due to the players phone number being the same as her deceased girlfriend, Ceres, that she never bothered to remove from her contacts.

Nova is a skateboarder punk and [[graffiti]] artist.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with pink [[streaked_hair|streaks]] and [[pink eyes]]. She wears a [[white shirt]] and [[black bra]], a [[blue shorts]], [[fishnets]], and pink [[shoes]]. She has 3 [[ear piercing]]s, a pink [[armlet]], a [[spiked bracelet]], and [[pink bracelet]].

title: raphtalia
body:
One of the main characters in [[Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari]]. She is a [[raccoon girl]] who is sold as a slave to [[Iwatani Naofumi]] aka the Shield Hero to compensate for his lack of offensive power.

She has [[raccoon ears]], a [[raccoon tail]], [[red eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[short dress]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[brown gloves]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[knee boots]], [[brown belt]], and [[arm guards]]. She also has a [[slave brand|slave]] [[breast tattoo|breast]]/[[chest tattoo]].

She resembles a [[child]] during her debut in the series, however, she rapidly grows up to an [[aged up|adult size]].

title: houquet_et_rose
body:
One of the main characters from the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] science fiction [[mecha]] anime series.

[b]Houquet Et Rose[/b] is an attractive, if grumpy, 16-year-old former [[motorcycle]] gang member who becomes part of [[Stick Bernard]]'s band of human rebels fighting against the [[Inbit]] [[alien]] invaders. She is probably the most skilled biker in the squad. 

Houquet's mecha of choice is a red [i]VR-038L Bartley[/i] [[mospeada_(mecha)|Mospeada]], but she is a fast learner, becoming a skilled pilot after Stick teaches her how to use a red [[Legioss]] too. 

Her name was changed to [[Rook Bartley]] in the [[Robotech]] American adaptation of the series.

title: mahoutsukai_no_yakusoku
body:
[b]Promise of Wizard[/b] (魔法使いの約束, mahoutsukai no yakusoku), or most widely known as [b]Mahoyaku[/b], is a mobile, otome-styled game with no romance created by Coly. In this game, players are tasked to train the wizards from the different countries in order to defend the world from the mysterious chaos brought by the moon. This game was officially released on November 26th, 2019. Other notable games created by Coly are [i][[On Air!]][/i] and [i][[Stand My Heroes]][/i].

title: w.d._gaster
body:
A dummied-out character in [[Undertale]] that can normally only be found through hacking.

[spoiler]The previous royal scientist who, among other things, created the CORE and fell into "his creation," resulting in him being scattered across time and space and forgotten by almost everyone in the underground. He is also thought to be connected to [[Sans (undertale)|]] due to the skull-shaped beam cannons that he wields in his boss fight being named "[[gasterblaster]]" within the game's files, and is generally assumed in most speculation to be Sans and [[Papyrus (Undertale)| Papyrus]]' older brother or father.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Because any information relevant to him, or even any mention of his name and (former) existence, in the game can normally only be found through hacking, much of the information circulated about Gaster is conjecture. His appearance is commonly speculated to be that of the mysterious figure who looks similar to [[Uboa]] appearing in one of the game's dummied-out rooms.[/spoiler]

title: gasterblaster
body: Floating [[skull]]s used in battle by [spoiler][[Sans (undertale)|]] during the Genocide Route of [[Undertale]].[/spoiler] They fire powerful [[laser]]s from their mouths.

title: sans_(undertale)
body:
A lazy [[skeleton]] in [[Undertale]]. Brother of [[Papyrus (undertale)|Papyrus]]. Speaks in the [[Comic Sans]] font. [spoiler]Final boss of the 'Genocide' route.[/spoiler]

He wears a [[blue jacket]]/[[blue hoodie|hoodie]], [[white shirt]], [[black shorts]], and [[slippers]], and is always [[grin]]ning in the game. [spoiler]In his battle as the final boss of the Genocide Route, he is seen with a distinct [[glowing eye|glowing left eye]] when using telekinesis, and fights with [[bone]]s and [[gasterblaster]]s as well. [/spoiler][spoiler]At one point during his battle, you're offered the option to spare him, which results in him killing you. In English, he exclaims "geeettttttt dunked on!!!", while in Japanese, he comments that all he did "was try to hug you...", "prompting differences":https://twitter.com/Zarla_S/status/1631924060878954496 in fanart based on the region.[/spoiler]

During the peak of the game's popularity, Sans gained [[meme]]tic status due to his association with edgy and angsty teens on the internet, as well as numerous fan games involving him that were usually cheaply made and unfairly hard. His fan-made alternate universe versions would similarly be swept up in memes.

h4.See also

* [[Tumblr Sexyman Tournament]]

title: subway
body:
A passenger transport system in an urban area with a high capacity and frequency, and grade separation from other traffic. Rapid transit systems are typically located either in underground tunnels or on elevated viaducts above street level. Outside urban centers, rapid transit lines may run on grade separated ground level tracks.

On Danbooru, the tag is used to either refer to the subway train or the [[subway station]].

title: vf-0
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] universe. 

In the [[macross zero|Macross Zero]] OVA series, the [[U.N. Spacy]] [b]VF-0 Phoenix[/b] [[variable fighter]] was an advanced "atmosphere-only" prototype for the [[vf-1|VF-1]] [b]Valkyrie[/b]. It served as a flight test unit and later (in 2008) as a frontline fighter, before the Valkyrie's initial mass production in November of the same year.

The VF-0 resembled the VF-1, although its legs were longer because the EGF-127 conventional turbofan engines used by the fighter were larger and bulkier than the VF-1's FF-2001 thermonuclear engines.

Weapons included a Gatling-style [[gunpod]], missiles, bombs, and other munitions. Like the later VF-1, the VF-0 could also mount booster packs. Variants include the [[vf-0a|VF-0A]], [[vf-0b|VF-0B]], [[vf-0d|VF-0D]], [[vf-0s|VF-0S]] and [[VF-0S Armored]].

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[kawamori_shouji|Kawamori Shouji]].

h4. See also

* [[sv-51|SV-51]]

title: shiraori
body:
Also called "White" or "Shiro" ("白").  Literally means "White Weaver".

A major character revealed part way into [[Kumo Desu Ga Nani Ka?]]  She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] which [[hair between eyes|come down between the eyes]] and is partly tied in a [[braid]], [[red eyes]] that have [[extra pupils]] (which she canonically keeps [[closed eyes|closed]] to prevent people from seeing), and typically wears a red [[choker]] with a [[flower]] on the side, a [[white dress]] that has very [[wide sleeves]] and a [[side slit]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]].  She wields a [[scythe]] as her weapon.

Remember when tagging that Shiarori's identity is a [[spoilers|spoiler]], and any posts that are give a hint to her identity should be tagged as such.  Do not tag [spoilers]Kumoko[/spoilers] unless both characters are actually present in the image.

See also: "Her page on the Kumo Desu Ga Wiki":https://kumodesu.fandom.com/wiki/Shiraori

title: metal_gear_solid_4:_guns_of_the_patriots
body:
[b]Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots[/b] is a 2008 stealth action video game developed by Kojima Productions and published by [[Konami]] for the PlayStation 3 game console. 

It is the sixth [[Metal Gear (series)|]] title directed by [[Kojima Hideo]].

The game is set five years after the events of [[Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty]] and continues the adventures and battles of [[Solid Snake]].

title: turn_a_gundam_(mobile_suit)
body:
The titular [[mecha]] from the [[Turn A Gundam]] anime series from 1999. Also known as the "[[Mustache]] Gundam" (in [[otaku]] circles) or "White Doll" (by the series' characters).

The [b]SYSTEM ∀-99 ∀ (read as: Turn A) Gundam[/b] is officially considered the strongest and most powerful Gundam [[mobile suit]] in the entire franchise because of its [[Moonlight Butterfly (gundam)|]] superweapon, and also due to its expanded specifications in the manga.

It is notable because of its peculiar look and the fact that it was designed by the legendary [[united_states|American]] [[science fiction]] film designer [[Syd Mead]].

title: castella_(food)
body:
A type of [[wagashi]] based on the "Nanban confectionery" (confectionery imported from abroad to Japan during the Azuchi–Momoyama period). The batter is poured into large square or rectangular molds, baked in an oven and cut into long rectangular shapes. Since the recipe calls for mizuame, a type of sugar syrup, Castella has a moist texture. 

h4.See also

* [[Suzu castella (food)|]]: castella batter cooked in a [[takoyaki pan]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: matilda_ajan
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] series. She appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

[b]Matilda Ajan[/b] is the commander of the [[Earth Federation]] Medea Supply Unit. In accordance with [[General Revil]]'s special order, she continues to send a large amount of supplies to [[White Base]] without any escort, using only Medea transport planes in a daring formation.

Matilda is very good looking and many of the young male personnel of the White Base were always finding ways of taking photos with her. [spoilers]Even [[Amuro Ray]] had a crush on her. Sadly, Matilda dies during one of her supply missions to the ship when her transport was attacked by the [[Black Tri-stars]].[/spoilers]

title: suga_itsuri
body:
[b]Suga Itsuri[/b] ([b]須賀乙莉[/b]) is a playable character in [[Alice Gear Aegis]]. 

She is a fashion model with height, which is 186 centimeters (6 feet).She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], and her [[brown eyes]]. 

Her suit is a [[underbust]] ,purple [[revealing clothes]], wearing white [[detached sleeves]] and [[black gloves]] and [[black thighhighs]].

The origin of her name is [[Tokyo Skytree]], the highest in Japan.

Itsuri is a member of [b] Team Dokuson[/b] along with [[Kimikage Yui]] and [[Murao mira]].

The origin of the team name is the Japanese idioms "Yuiga Dokuson"(唯我独尊). It is a combination of Kimikage Yui's "Yui" and Murao Mira(村尾未羅) 's "村(son.kanji phonetic reading).suga itsuri is not related to the team name because she will join the team later.


h4. External Links

* WikiWikiJP: "Suga Itsuri":[https://wikiwiki.jp/alicegear/須賀乙莉]

title: murao_mira
body:
[b]Murao Mira[/b] ([b]村尾未羅[/b]) is a playable character in [[Alice Gear Aegis]]. 

She is a fashion model with a height, which is 164 centimeters (5.4 feet).She has [[light brown hair]] [[short hair]], and her [[purple eyes]]. 

Her suit is a [[underbust]] , [[skeleton]] as a motif Black [[revealing clothes]], wearing [[detached sleeves]] [[black gloves]] and [[multicolored_legwear|multicolored]] [[thighhighs]].

The origin of her name is "村尾→Sonbi→ [[Zombie]]" and "未羅→Mira→Miira([[Mummy]])".

She is a member of [b] Team Dokuson[/b] along with [[suga itsuri]] and [[Kimikage Yui]].

The origin of the team name is the Japanese idioms "Yuiga Dokuson"(唯我独尊). It is a combination of Kimikage Yui's "Yui" and Murao Mira(村尾未羅) 's "村(son.kanji phonetic reading).suga itsuri is not related to the team name because she will join the team later.

title: embodiment_of_scarlet_devil
body:
東方紅魔郷 ("Touhou Koumakyou") ~ the Embodiment of Scarlet Devil
("Eastern Lands of the Scarlet Devil")

Sixth game of the [[Touhou]] series and the first for the Windows generation, released 11 August 2002 after a 4-year hiatus.

One summer day [[Gensokyo]] was suddenly enveloped in a scarlet mist, blotting out the sun and turning the land into a cold wasteland. Miko [[Hakurei Reimu]] and witch [[Kirisame Marisa]] investigate the cause - a mysterious entity known as the "[[remilia_scarlet|Scarlet Devil]]".

Preceded by [[Mystic Square]] and followed by [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]].


h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Hakurei Reimu]]
* [[Kirisame Marisa]]

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Midboss/Boss: [[Rumia]]
* Stage 2 Midboss: [[Daiyousei]]
* Stage 2 Boss: [[Cirno]]
* Stage 3 Midboss/Boss: [[Hong Meiling]]
* Stage 4 Midboss: [[Koakuma]]
* Stage 4 Boss, Extra Stage Midboss: [[Patchouli Knowledge]]
* Stage 5 Midboss/Boss, Final Stage Midboss: [[Izayoi Sakuya]]
* Final Stage Boss: [[Remilia Scarlet]]
* Extra Stage Boss: [[Flandre Scarlet]]

h5. Removed
* [[Satsuki Rin]]

title: midjourney
body:
A generative artificial intelligence program and service created and operated by the self-named independent research organization based in San Francisco. Midjourney, like OpenAI's [[DALL-E]] and Stability AI's [[Stable Diffusion]], generates images from natural language descriptions called "prompts".

As with any [[AI-generated]] tools, Midjourney-created images were forbidden, unless the image was sufficiently altered enough from the original to be qualified as [[AI-assisted]] (such as using it simply for the background image).

title: toned_male
body:
Also known as "ottermode" in some English speaking fitness circles.

Visible male musculature from low body fat, or by being athletic. The character may have well developed [[abs]] but little else. 
The character should look slim or slender, not buff or bulky. Think track and field, not body building.

Do not use together with the [[muscular]] tag when describing one character. 

* [b] Comparison with [[muscular male]][/b]

Details like bulkiness of the [[thick arms |arms]], [[thick neck|neck]] and [[broad shoulders]] are a good way to distinguish between [[toned]] and [[muscular]] builds.

[i]Do not use [/i][[pectorals]] size alone as a determinant for this tag. It is common in artwork to draw them unproportional to the rest of the body, especially with [[manboobs]] etc.

* !post #7055700
* !asset #13418660
* !post #4668612
* !post #4200789

h4. Examples

* !post #4245734 
* !post #4216619 
* !post #2524496 
* !post #4239546

[spoiler]He takes on the appearance of [[Final Fantasy I]]'s [[Warrior of Light (ff1)|Warrior of Light]] for his boss fight in [i]Shadowbringers[/i]. In [i]Endwalker[/i], it is revealed he was once known as [[Themis (ff14)|Themis]].[/spoiler]

title: noelle_francesca
body:
[b]Noelle francesca[/b] ([b]ノエル・ フランシスカ[/b]) is playable character in [i][[Alice Gear Aegis]][/i].

She has [[blonde hair]] in a [[ponytail]], and her [[green eyes]]. 
Her suit is a white [[highleg leotard]] with the motif of the [[French flag]], wearing white [[elbow gloves]] and [[white thighhighs]].

She is [[nicole francesca]]'s sister.
other_names: ノエル・フランシスカ

title: agatsuma_kei
body: [b]Agatsuma Kei[/b] ([b]吾妻 京[/b]) is a playable character in [[Alice Gear Aegis]]. She is [[Agatsuma Kaede]]'s older sister.

title: alice_gear_aegis
body:
[b]Alice Gear Aegis[/b] is a free-to-play 3D shooting game developed by Pyramid and published by COLOPL. It was released on January 21st, 2018 for Android and iOS. title: strongman_waist
body:
In contrast to the slimmer waist commonly seen with bodybuilders ([[v-taper]]), a [i]strongman waist[/i] is a thick, wide and [[muscular]] waist that is typical of strongmen and represents strength over aesthetics. It is a common design choice with the homoerotic [[bara]] art style.

Use with [[belly]] and [[plump]] if drawn softly, but there has to be at least a hint of musculature to warrant using this tag.

* Comparison and examples
* !asset #5812861
* !post #6978138 
* !post #7434813
* !post #7443216

h4. See also

* [[broad shoulders]]
* [[muscular male]]
* [[belly]] 
* [[plump]] 
* [[fat man]] 



h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Strongman":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strongman]
* "Muscular body comparison":[https://www.deviantart.com/coelasquid/art/Abdomination-How-to-draw-beef-132538271]

title: penguin_keeper_(diva)
body:
Character by [[diva (hyxpk)|diva]]. She is the protagonist of [[zookeepers (diva)|Zookeepers]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]]. Her working uniform usually consists of a [[white shirt]], [[black overalls]], a [[black scarf]], [[black footwear|black]] [[rubber boots]] and a [[penguin hat]].

She is the younger sister of [[polar bear keeper (diva)|Polar bear keeper]].

title: kaneko_lumi_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Phase Connect]]'s [[Kaneko Lumi]], as seen in post #7439657.

A [[space]]-themed costume, she now wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket]] worn over a [[black leotard]] with an [[underboob cutout]], [[white pants]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]]. Rather peculiarly, she has an option to [[naked jacket|remove all the inner garments]] except a black [[pasties]] covering her nipples with this costume.

title: it's_over_anakin_i_have_the_high_ground_(meme)
body:
A climatic [[scene reference|scene]] from [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith]] during the duel between [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker]] on [[Mustafar]].

In the final sequence, Obi-Wan, who stands on a mound and in an advantageous position says "It's over, Anakin. I have the high ground!", Anakin responds with, "You underestimate my power!" [spoiler]Anakin then proceeds to jump over in an attempt to attack Obi-Wan, prompting the latter to sever three out of four of Anakin's limbs (save for his prosthetic right arm) with his [[lightsaber]], defeating him.[/spoiler]

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: I Have The High Ground":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/i-have-the-high-ground]
other_names: 終わりだアナキン、私の方が有利だ

title: hygogg
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]MSM-03C Hygogg[/b]

A highly redesigned version of the underwhelming [[Gogg]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], with standardized parts for ease of maintenance and much greater maneuverability both on land and water. The few Hygoggs that survived the One Year War found themselves in the hands of pirates, and surfaced as late as [[gundam_unicorn|U.C. 0096.]]

title: heater
body:
A heater, or space heater, is a device used to heat a single small area, such as a room.  These devices generate heat through various means, such as burning fuel or using electricity to heat coils.

h5. Types

* [[Kerosene heater]]
* [[Potbelly stove]]
* [[space heater]]

h4. See Also

* "Wikipedia - Space Heater":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_heater]

title: space_heater
body: A [[space heater]] is a small, portable [[heater]] designed to heat a single occupied space at a time (hence its name), thus making it more efficient than whole-house heating. They come in many shapes and sizes, but are generally about half a person's height or smaller.

title: teekyuu
body:
[i][b]Teekyuu[/b] (てーきゅう)[/i] is an ongoing sports comedy manga series written by [[Roots (jt_roots)|]] and illustrated by Piyo with an ongoing anime adaption. The name is a pun on the Japanese word for tennis, teikyuu. It has a spin-off series, [[Usakame]].
